btc-rpc-explorer.about: This is a self-hosted explorer for the Bitcoin blockchain, driven by RPC calls to your own Bitcoin node. It is easy to run and can be connected to other tools (like Electrum servers) to achieve a full-featured explorer.

btcpayserver.about: BTCPay Server is a free and open-source Bitcoin payment processor which allows you to accept bitcoin without fees or intermediaries.
btcpayserver.shortDescription: Accept Bitcoin payments. Free, open-source & self-hosted, Bitcoin payment processor.

lnbits.about: LNbits is a very simple Python server that sits on top of any funding source, and can be used as an accounts system to mitigate the risk of exposing applications to your full balance, via unique API keys for each wallet.
lnbits.shortDescription: Free and open-source lightning-network wallet/accounts system

mempool.about: An open-source explorer developed for the Bitcoin community, focusing on the emerging transaction fee market to help our transition into a multi-layer ecosystem.
mempool.shortDescription: An open-source explorer developed for the Bitcoin community

rtl.about: RTL is a full function, device agnostic, web user interface to help manage Lightning node operations. RTL is available on LND, Core Lightning and Eclair implementations.
rtl.shortDescription: A full function web browser app for LND, Core Lightning and Eclair

specter.about: Bitcoin Core has a very powerful command line interface and a wonderful daemon. Using PSBT and HWI it can also work with hardware wallets, but at the moment it is too linux-way. The same applies to multisignature setups. The goal of this project is to make a convenient and user-friendly GUI around Bitcoin Core with a focus on multisignature setup with hardware wallets and airgapped devices.
specter.shortDescription: A desktop GUI for Bitcoin Core optimised to work with hardware wallets

thunderhub.about: ThunderHub is an open-source LND node manager where you can manage and monitor your node on any device or browser. It allows you to take control of the lightning network with a simple and intuitive UX and the most up-to-date tech stack.
thunderhub.shortDescription: LND Lightning Node Manager in your Browser

jam.about: Jam is a web interface for JoinMarket focusing on user-friendliness and ease-of-use. It aims to provide sensible defaults and be easy to use for beginners while still having the features advanced users expect.
jam.shortDescription: Jam - A web interface for JoinMarket

electrs.about: Electrs is an efficient re-implementation of Electrum Server in Rust. It indexes the entire Bitcoin blockchain, and allows your Lightning node to query it for on-chain transactions.
electrs.shortDescription: Efficient re-implementation of Electrum Server in Rust
electrs.initialSync: The index database needs to be created before Electrum Server can be used. This can take hours / days depending on your RaspiBlitz. Please check back later.
electrs.connectLocal: Connect to Electrum Server over Local Network
electrs.connectTor: Connect to Electrum Server over Tor
electrs.connectionInfo: Use these addresses to connect your apps to your Bitcoin node. You can use the local connection if you are on the same network or the Tor address if you are using Tor.

alby.shortDescription: Connect your RaspiBlitz LND node and use Bitcoin & Nostr apps with the Alby Extension

connection.hint: Please install the Alby extension first
connection.success: Raspiblitz account was added to Alby
connection.error: Adding Raspiblitz to Alby didn't work, please try again

setup.blockchain_found_long: On your HDD/SSD existing blockchain data was found.
setup.cancel_setup: Do you really want to cancel the setup process
setup.cl: Bitcoin Full Node with Core Lightning Implementation
setup.cl_description: Core Lightning (formerly known as c-lightning) is a Lightning Network implementation by Blockstream focused on performance and extendibility for developers and advanced users.
setup.convertwarning: RaspiBlitz can only convert your Blockchain and Lightning data (funds + channels) at the moment. Data from additional installed apps might get deleted in the migraton process.
setup.done_migration_ready: OK. Everything is ready to migrate to RaspiBlitz.
setup.done_recover_ready: OK. Everything is ready to recover your RaspiBlitz.
setup.done_setup_ready: OK. Everything is ready to setup your RaspiBlitz.
setup.done_update_ready: OK. Everything is ready to update your RaspiBlitz.
setup.final_info_reboot: I have written down my seed words and their correct order
setup.final_seedwords: Please write down your seed words. These can be used to recover your lightning wallet. The order in which they appear matters. Never share your seed words with anyone, and keep them safe!
setup.lightningoutdated: The node you want to migrate from uses a newer Lightning version than this RaspiBlitz. Please wait for an updated release. You can shutdown and startup with your old node sd card - no changes were made.
setup.lnd: Bitcoin Full Node with Lightning LND Implementation
setup.lnd_description: Adding the Lightning Network Daemon (LND), developed by Lightning Labs, to a Bitcoin full node introduces capabilities for faster and cheaper transactions. LND is one of the most popular and user-friendly implementations of the Lightning Network.
setup.migrate_to_os: Do you want to migrate from {{os}} to RaspiBlitz?
setup.password_a_details: Also known as <0>Password A</0>. Use this password for login to your RaspiBlitz.
setup.password_b_details: Also known as <0>Password B</0>. Some apps require a password to install.
setup.password_c_details: Also known as <0>Password C</0>. This will be used to access your lightning or bitcoin wallet.
setup.password_error_chars: Password should just contain characters & numbers.
setup.password_error_length: Password needs to be at least 8 characters long.
setup.restartinfo: Please wait until RaspiBlitz answers again
setup.none_description: Running a Bitcoin full node without any Lightning Network implementation involves participating directly in the Bitcoin network by validating transactions and blocks.
setup.select_lightning:

setup.select_lightning_help: What the difference? <0>Learn more</0> about each implementation.
setup.start_recovery: Would you like start the recovery process?
setup.start_update: Would you like to start the update and recovery process?
